name: Macro Oscillator 2
description: This algorithm is an implementation of the open source Plaits module by Ã‰milie Gillet. It should behave and sound identical to the original hardware version, which is based on v1.2 of the Plaits code. The disting NT relies on 'input' settings being enabled or disabled rather than detecting physical jack connections (unlike the original), so if a Trigger input setting is set to 'None', the algorithm generates constant sound; otherwise, it assumes triggers will be supplied via the selected bus.
use_cases: Wavetable synthesis with extensive modulation capabilities
Pitch and envelope modulation via CV inputs or MIDI/I2C
Replacement for traditional oscillators in modular systems

input_ports.name: Trigger input (bus)
input_ports.description: Bus used as the trigger input. If set to 'None', the algorithm generates constant sound.

input_ports.name: Level input (bus)
input_ports.description: Bus used as the level input, modulating the amplitude of the output signal.

input_ports.name: CV input (bus)
input_ports.description: Bus used for pitch CV modulation. Can be controlled via MIDI/I2C if enabled.

input_ports.name: FM input (bus)
input_ports.description: Bus used as the FM modulation input, affecting synthesis model parameters.

input_ports.name: Harmonics input (bus)
input_ports.description: Bus used for harmonics CV modulation. Can be controlled via MIDI/I2C if enabled.

input_ports.name: Timbre input (bus)
input_ports.description: Bus used for timbre CV modulation. Can be controlled via MIDI/I2C if enabled.

input_ports.name: Morph input (bus)
input_ports.description: Bus used for morph CV modulation. Can be controlled via MIDI/I2C if enabled.

output_ports.name: Main output
output_ports.description: Primary audio output bus, mixed with Aux output if both use the same bus.

output_ports.name: Aux output
output_ports.description: Secondary audio output bus. Mixed with Main output if both use the same bus.
